TopicTitle: Maxmaps Previews Kerbal Space Program: Economic Boom

Articles.Content:
<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/xhiLsEZ2X1I" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>Here’s the YouTube version of Maxmaps’ preview of <em>Kerbal Space Program: Economic Boom</em>.</p>
Woot! I got the name right! (this is all i came here to say...)

Okay, i'm not sure about dis but...

1. Can buildings be destroyed in sandbox?

2. Can buildings be destroyed using BDArmory parts?

Okay, i'm not sure about dis but...

1. Can buildings be destroyed in sandbox?

2. Can buildings be destroyed using BDArmory parts?

1. He was in sandbox mode when he destroyed it in this video...

Anyways, nice to have an HD version of this! And great name too.
Yes it is a nice name. Chose the special one I have.

Pure awesomeness.

Also got a question: How hard would it be to disable the new navball vectors? It's a great feature, and I love it, but for my personal gameplay style, I'd like to have it invisible. (I also use the Navball Docking Alignment Indicator, which uses one of these "new" symbols, teehee.)
I knew Economic Boom would win. It's just so clever.
Can someone transcribe what did he said in SPH, when showcasing cargobays? I guess there is a new feature, but it's kinda hard to understand him in that moment.

Can someone transcribe what did he said in SPH, when showcasing cargobays? I guess there is a new feature, but it's kinda hard to understand him in that moment.

He mentioned surface attach can be disabled with a keybind

He mentioned surface attach can be disabled with a keybind

I'm pretty excited. He said it enabled part connecting green sphere to sphere. Just press the bind then rotate, place. I don't know which key he said though.

I'm pretty excited. He said it enabled part connecting green sphere to sphere. Just press the bind then rotate, place. I don't know which key he said though.

I believe you toggle it by holding alt.
I'm hoping you don't have to hold ALT down. I can imagine that having to hold ALT and press the rotate keys would be a pain.

"ghosting" of maneuver node indicator on navball is atually better that in enhanced navball..

But is there anti-maneuver node implemented too?
Thanks for the youtube format

I'm hoping you don't have to hold ALT down. I can imagine that having to hold ALT and press the rotate keys would be a pain.

Especially if you're doing fine rotation with Shift+WASD. Though I guess you could rotate the part, then press and hold Alt to place it.

I don't know about everyone else but I'm usually more excited about the little additions like the marker at KSP, etc.

Features are fine, but usability is just as important. I'll often find UI in games that look like they were designed by someone who never played games in their life.

Especially if you're doing fine rotation with Shift+WASD. Though I guess you could rotate the part, then press and hold Alt to place it.

It's definitely not a hassle to hold down alt during construction, although it sometimes can be if you also have to press shift. Nothing unworkable though

It's definitely not a hassle to hold down alt during construction, although it sometimes can be if you also have to press shift. Nothing unworkable though

I've been doing Ctrl-Alt-Delete since the age of DOS, I'm sure I'll manage a three-key combo.

I imagine there'll be a mod to correct the oversight and turn it into a toggle.

I don't know about everyone else but I'm usually more excited about the little additions like the marker at KSP, etc.

Yep, totally. I hope it's visible in map mode - kinda like RT2 places a red beacon for ease of identifying KSCs position.

Edited October 4, 2014 by TMS
Holding Alt is not a problem. I'm slightly concerned about possible interference with Alt + left click though.

Soon great stuff with the destructible vab (BDArmory will get my attention it deserve i wanted to save it for the multi but meeeeh destroy bulding is nice too)

the surface attachement is really nice for cargo bay.

PA and openttd got my attention for now but this
Ugh, I'm just going to call it 0.26. No name this go round as far as I'm concerned.

Ugh, I'm just going to call it 0.26. No name this go round as far as I'm concerned.

0.25

0.25

Lol, yay for fat fingers... or maybe it was wishful thinking, who knows.
We all have fat fingers at important times.
